description: The hosts trend dashboard displaying resources usage measurements over time - number of virtual machines, CPU, memory, and network Tx/Rx

panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays resource usage (number of virtual machines, CPU, memory, and network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over a selected period.

panels.description: This report displays average memory usage and peaks for a selected host over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the hosts
-- memory usage over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage"
FROM 
    (
        -- Hosts Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, MEM_Usage
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- BR2A - This query returns the hosts average
-- memory usage and peaks over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Average Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Average Memory Peaks"
FROM 
    (
        -- Hosts Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, MEM_Usage, MEM_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Average Memory Usage and Peaks (over time) (BR2A)

panels.description: This report displays average CPU usage and peaks for a selected host over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the hosts
-- CPU usage over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the hosts max and average CPU usage
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, CPU_Usage
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- BR2A - This query returns the hourly and daily hosts
-- CPU usage and peaks over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage",
    CPU_Peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the hosts max and average CPU usage
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, CPU_Usage, CPU_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Average CPU Usage and Peaks (over time) (BR2A)

panels.description: This report displays average number of virtual machines and peaks for a selected host over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the hosts
-- active VMs counts over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CAST ( VMS AS int ) AS "Number of Virtual Machines"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the hosts Max and average active vms counts
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS
        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, VMS
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- BR2A - This query returns the hourly and daily hosts
-- active VMs counts over time

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CAST ( VMS AS int ) AS "Avg. Number of Virtual Machines",
    CAST ( VMS_Peak AS int ) AS "Avg. Peaks of Number of Virtual Machines"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the hosts Max and average active vms counts
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS_Peak
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, active_vms, minutes_in_status, max_active_vms, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, active_vms, minutes_in_status, max_active_vms, host_status, host_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY sub_query.time, VMS, VMS_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Average Number of Virtual Machines and Peaks (over time) (BR2A)

panels.description: This report displays for the top 5 busiest Ethernet interfaces the average transmit and receive rates for a selected host over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns top 5 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, over time

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS "Avg. Receive Rate",
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS "Avg. Transmit Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM 
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples AS b
                            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        samples.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime 
                                        AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                            samples.host_status = 1
                            AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                            AND
                                CASE
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                        THEN 1=1
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                        THEN delete_date isnull
                                END
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                        LIMIT 5
                    )
            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY all_sub_queries.time, interface_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

-- BR2A - This query returns top 5 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, over time

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS "Avg. Receive Rate",
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS "Avg. Transmit Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id IN ($host_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                            ) AS hourly_daily
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime 
                                        AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                            hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                            AND
                                CASE
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                        THEN 1=1
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                        THEN delete_date isnull
                                END
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                        LIMIT 5
                    )
            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY all_sub_queries.time, interface_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Top 5 Busiest Ethernet Interfaces Tx and Rx Rates (over time) (BR2A)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts  								 									) 					) 	 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts  								 									) 					) 	 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND cluster_id  		    IN 			     			    ( 					 					SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 				 				) 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND cluster_id  		    IN 			     			    ( 					 					SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 				 				) 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( host_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN host_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN host_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				) 	 			AND cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')  			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date ISNULL 	                END
list.label: Host
list.name: host_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( host_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN host_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN host_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				) 	 			AND cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')  			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date ISNULL 	                END

title: Hosts Trend Dashboard
